results.title: Billal
results.creator_credit: Tom Zubrycki, ABC-TV (Australia), AFFC and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Tom Zubrycki was intending to make a documentary film about unemployed youth in Sydney’s western suburbs when he came across the Etters, a Lebanese Muslim family who had migrated to Australia. What was initially meant to be a film exploring migration and class relationships in urban Australia became something else when the second son, Billal, was the victim of a racially motivated attack which left him brain damaged. As Zubrycki allows his camera to explore each individual family member’s response to the accident, the film becomes an exploration of grief and suffering, and a tribute to the young man’s attempt to adjust to his new situation. Billal and his family infuse their stories with humour and insight, and as the film explores Billal’s rehabilitation, it also becomes an absurd commentary on the under-resourced Australian public health system. “Billal” is then a documentary which is largely about family, and of how a family deals with the tragic consequences of violence. But it is also, of course, a documentary which with subtlety and piquancy, illuminates the destructive effects of racism.

results.title: Bill Tilden's advanced tennis
results.creator_credit: Julian Peyser and New Official Films
results.brief_description: Bill Tilden narrates and demonstrates advanced techniques of tennis, including net game, foot work, smash, service and volley. Front, back, aside and overhead views permit study of his playing technique from a variety of angles.

results.title: Bill Cosby on prejudice
results.brief_description: In a makeup that is a cross between the mask of an African storyteller and a harlequin, comic Bill Cosby’s bigot destroys the human race. Under his spoofing lies a serious comment that stimulates honest discussion of the problems of racial prejudice. Photographer: Walter Eby; music: Willie Ruff.

results.title: Bilingual kids
results.creator_credit: James Mann and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: This program is designed to introduce teachers, parents and communities to the concept of bilingual education. It looks at processes involved in the implementation of the Greek:English Bilingual Pilot Project in the Richmond-Collingwood area. A number of evaluation findings are also discussed

results.title: Biko: Breaking the silence
results.brief_description: A political documentary shot in Zimbabwe and South Africa, this commemorates the 10th anniversary of Steve Biko’s death. It provides an insight into the complexities of the politics of the last decade, pivoting on the powerfully influential character of Biko. The film defines the aims of the Black Consciousness Movement of which Biko was an active and important leader, and explores its relevance from inception in the late 60s to the present day. It includes interviews with friends and medical and professional colleagues.

results.title: Bike people
results.creator_credit: Phil Kassel and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: More and more people are riding bikes today, and here the basic safety precautions, optional equipment and protection against theft are discussed. The film explains bike vehicle code rules which are designed to make riding safe and fun, and points out that equipment can add to safe riding.

results.title: Bike ed in action; be seen to be safe.
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Mark Laughlin, David Ferris, Ivan Gaal, Bike Ed and Materials production, Education Dept
results.brief_description: This compilation tape consists of two programs covering various aspects of bicycle safety. “Bike ed in action” highlights the alarming accident rate among Victorian cyclists and reviews the Bike Education Curriculum Unit which aims to develop positive cycling safety skills. Basic cycling safety measures are demonstrated. “Be seen to be safe” looks at some of the precautions young cyclists must take to ensure that they are seen at night.
